decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to abuse the flicker mechanic in combination with creatures that provide value upon entering the battlefield. By repeatedly flickering cards like Mulldrifter, Sea Gate Oracle, and God-Pharaoh's Faithful, the player can generate card advantage and control the board while slowly grinding out their opponent. Sunscape Familiar helps to reduce the cost of these spells, making the combo more efficient. Meeting of Minds allows for card draw to find the necessary pieces, and cards like Mortuary Mire and Ephemerate provide additional utility and recursion. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through repeated flickering and efficient plays.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize a combination of card draw, land bouncing, and fog effects to stall the game while assembling a powerful combo win condition. By using cards like Behold the Multiverse and Frantic Inventory to draw into key pieces, and combining them with LÃ³rien Revealed and Quandrix Campus for mana generation, the deck aims to eventually overwhelm the opponent with a large amount of card advantage and life gain. The goal is to outlast the opponent and set up a game-winning combo while preventing them from dealing damage.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive play style, utilizing cheap artifacts to quickly build a strong board presence. It also includes cards that can deal direct damage to the opponent's creatures or life total. The deck aims to control the game by efficiently utilizing mana and resources, while also maintaining a steady flow of card draw to keep up the pressure. By combining artifacts with cards that benefit from their presence, the deck can quickly build a formidable army and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to recover.

This deck focuses on playing cheap artifacts quickly and efficiently, using cards like Springleaf Drum and Thoughtcast to accelerate. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with creatures like Gingerbrute, Myr Enforcer, and Frogmite, while also utilizing cards like Galvanic Blast for direct damage. The deck also includes cards like All That Glitters to pump up creatures, making them even more threatening. Additionally, the deck includes plenty of artifact lands like Ancient Den and Great Furnace to help cast spells more easily. Overall, the deck has a fast-paced, aggressive strategy centered around affinity cards.

This deck focuses on using a combo of sacrificing goblins to generate mana and draw cards, allowing for quick deck acceleration and setting up for a powerful finish. The inclusion of key cards like First Day of Class and Ichor Wellspring provide additional value while fueling the combo engine. The deck also includes disruption elements like Duress and Mesmeric Fiend to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless stream of goblin creatures and explosive combos.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient removal and counterspells to control the game, while also utilizing card draw and graveyard recursion to maintain resources. The win condition revolves around playing powerful creatures like Gurmag Angler and Fallaji Archaeologist, while disrupting opponents with spells like Snuff Out and Counterspell. The deck aims to outvalue opponents through card advantage and efficient resource management, ultimately grinding out a victory through a combination of control elements and powerful threats.

This deck focuses on using a combination of cycling cards and graveyard recursion to generate a large amount of mana and gain card advantage. By cycling through cards like Street Wraith and Architects of Will, and then casting spells like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual, the deck can quickly build up mana and get ahead on resources. Reaping the Graves and Songs of the Damned are key combo pieces that allow you to bring back creatures and generate even more mana, enabling explosive plays and overwhelming your opponent.

This Pauper 1 vs 1 deck focuses on gaining control through the use of Gates and various spells. The main strategy involves using Basilisk Gate, Citadel Gate, and other Gates to control the board while utilizing creatures like Sacred Cat and Guardian of the Guildpact for defense. Brainstorm and Preordain are used for card advantage and control, while Counterspell and Prismatic Strands help prevent opponent's spells from resolving. Journey to Nowhere and other removal spells help deal with threats, making it difficult for opponents to maintain board presence.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce their life total. The deck aims to maintain a fast pace by playing low-cost creatures like Goblin Bushwhacker and Goblin Blast-Runner, while also including efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast. With a mix of direct damage and creature threats, this deck is designed to apply early pressure and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.
